content: half the entire shawl is worked in one piece down to the scalloped border and then the lace edge is grafted together at the top of the neck patterning is worked on both right and wrong sides for the majority of the shawl needle size to achieve an appropriate texture in the main lace pattern i recommend using needles one size smaller than you usually would for the yarn weight you have chosen stitch markers the 4 markers will separate the lace edge on each side and the 2 center stitches from the rest of the shawl once placed slip all markers as you come to them important if using the written instructions you must use all 4 markers for the instructions to make sense twisted stitches ktbl and ptbl a design detail that adds a lovely texture to the main lace pattern is the use of twisted stitches on a reverse stockinette background on the right side these twisted stitches are worked by knitting a stitch through the back loop on the wrong side that same stitch is purled through the back loop this video www youtube com/watch v=1mguemn7mnc shows how the knit and purl twisted stitches are worked provisional cast on a provisional cast on is used to begin this shawl you will be casting on 10 stitches that will become the beginning 4 stitches of both sides of the lace edge as well as the 2 center stitches these stitches are grafted together after the shawl is bound off my favorite provisional cast on method is a crochet cast on where a crochet hook is used to place the provisional stitches onto the knitting needle with waste yarn feel free to use the method of your choice but a turkish cast on is not recommended and will not necessarily yield the same results here is a link to an excellent video which shows this provisional cast on https //www youtube com/watch v=uonyh4ch3aw an alternative way to do a crochet cast on is shown on this video www youtube com/watch v=3ogg0aij3xe lace edge bind-off stitches at the beginning of some edge row on both the right and wrong sides there are 4 stitches to be bound off using a basic bind off as follows knit the first two stitches pull the first stitch over the second stitch and off the needle this is considered the first stitch bound off then knit another stitch and again bind off the first stitch over the second stitch this is the second stitch bound off do that 2 more times for the third and fourth stitches bound off there will be one stitch remaining on your right needle size customization if you wish to customize the size you may work more or fewer repeats of chart 2 each chart 2 repeat will add or subtract about 5-6 13-15 cm to or from the overall wingspan length for a kerchief size four repeats of chart 2 will measure about 48 x 22 122
